author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Come March 23, separatists from Kashmir will crowd Pakistan’s High Commission in New Delhi to participate in the ‘Pakistan Day’ celebrations. However, All Parties Hurriyat Conference (APHC) chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, who pledges to play a “positive role” between India and Pakistan, will push for an “exclusive working group” on Kashmir.

Speaking to The Hindu , Mr. Farooq said: “The meeting should not be looked at as one where separatists intend to conspire against India. Such meetings allow us to play a positive role between India and Pakistan to take forward the dialogue process.”

Mr. Farooq, who will head a delegation on March 23 to New Delhi, said the Hurriyat would press on Pakistan “to have a separate working group with India on Kashmir, which will work out a mechanism on involving the leadership from J&K for a final solution.” “There is need to de-link Kashmir from other issues like terror,” he added.

Welcomes new talks

Welcoming fresh engagement between India and Pakistan on the sidelines of the SAARC meeting in Nepal, the Mirwaiz stressed that the two countries “should allow greater contact between people of erstwhile J&K, divided by the Line of Control.”
title: ‘India, Pakistan must have working group on Kashmir’
